p: For the CRF01 outbreak, there is weak evidence (45%) in favor of the BA network type although the ER was also supported with a posterior probability of 39%, with small differences in the parameter estimates. The infection rate in the acute phase was λ 1 = 0.018(0.009, 0.031) vs λ 1 = 0.023(0.0015, 0.036), γ = 0.001(0.0006, 0.002) vs γ = 0.001(0.0005, 0.002) and the mean degree was 3.2(2.4, 3.6) vs 3.7(2.2, 4.1) in the BA and ER respectively. The HIV-1 subtype B outbreak was mostly (57%) associated with an ER network type. However, there was considerable uncertainty in the parameter estimates: λ 1 = 0.0025(0.001, 0.004), γ = 0.0003(0.0003, 0.001) and the mean degree 1.4(1.3, 2.1).
